intro: Phoradendron caracasanum, commonly known as the Caracas mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the Viscaraceae family. It grows on the branches of host trees, primarily in the tropical regions of South America. The plant has a smooth, glabrous surface and produces small, white or pale green berries that are toxic to animals. Its leaves are opposite and elliptic, with a leathery texture. The species plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for certain bird species, despite its toxic properties.
